main_business: Communications, Mobility, and Consumer Devices Service Industries
description: CTDI is a full-service, global engineering, repair, and logistics company that provides best-cost, end-to-end technical supply chain solutions to the world's leading telecom carriers, cable companies, and OEMs. They specialize in forward and reverse logistics, bolstered by industry-leading testing technology and repair/refurbishment services.
products_services: STB / CPE Division: Screen & clean, OEM certified repair, and high-volume logistics of set-top boxes, gateways, EMTAs, and remote controls.
Mobile & Consumer Electronics (MCE) Division: Test, repair, and refurbishment of smartphones, tablets, audio devices, and laptops.
Mobility Product Solutions (MPS) Division: Best-in-class mobility supply chain, trade-in programs, auction platforms, parts reclamation, and fulfillment.
Network Services (NS) Division: Fully integrated test, repair, and logistics of 4G & 5G wireline and wireless network infrastructure equipment, including network deployment.
Product / Supply Division: Turn-key product solutions, kitting, accessories, packaging, vendor-managed inventory, and asset lifecycle management.
Hyperscale AI Data Center and Cloud Services (Hyperscale 360): Engineering, program management, and logistics for large-scale IT infrastructure programs.

summary:
Founded in 1975 by the Parsons family, Communications Test Design, Inc. (CTDI) has grown from a small family business into a global leader in engineering, repair, and logistics for the communications industry. Headquartered in West Chester, Pennsylvania, CTDI operates over 100 facilities in more than 20 countries, employing over 20,000 people. The company serves major telecom carriers, cable service providers, and OEMs worldwide through its five core divisions: STB/CPE, Mobile & Consumer Electronics, Mobility Product Solutions, Network Services, and Product/Supply, with a recent addition for Hyperscale AI Data Center services.

CTDI's business model is built on technical innovation, particularly in automated, multi-unit, and robotic test systems for devices ranging from smartphones to 5G network equipment. They provide comprehensive forward and reverse logistics, repair, refurbishment, and supply chain management, emphasizing a circular economy through their Planet Protect sustainability program. The company maintains a strong family culture and is committed to corporate social responsibility, community engagement through CTDI CARES, and supplier diversity.
